Articles.Content:
I've never really seen anything like this in the mod section:

![nasm_ar234_24.jpg](http://www.cybermodeler.com/aircraft/ar234/images/nasm_ar234_24.jpg)

Sorry for the swastika in the background.

Maybe I'm just blind. If so, please point me at the right mod having a part like this. Not very realistic for atmospheric re-entries, but would be awesome to see what's under your feet when landing.

E: Sorry for not marking it as [Request]. Kinda forgot and not sure if now I can change it.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-16T21:14:43Z" title="03/16/2015 09:14  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 16, 2015</time> by sumghai**
  
Added [Request] tag

> 
> I've never really seen anything like this in the mod section:
> [http://www.cybermodeler.com/aircraft/ar234/images/nasm_ar234_24.jpg](http://www.cybermodeler.com/aircraft/ar234/images/nasm_ar234_24.jpg)
> 
> Sorry for the swastika in the background.
> 
> Maybe I'm just blind. If so, please point me at the right mod having a part like this. Not very realistic for atmospheric re-entries, but would be awesome to see what's under your feet when landing.
> 
> E: Sorry for not marking it as [Request]. Kinda forgot and not sure if now I can change it.

to fix the marking, go into the advanced post editor tool and it will give you access to the thread markings

I think [this mod](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/98041-WIP-Some-stuff-I-ve-been-working-on-WWII-Cockpits-Propeller-Engines-VentureStar) has something similar to what you are looking for. The second cockpit in the screenshot album is what I am referring to.

Lacks SXT has a similar cockpit [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/79542-25-SXT-Lack-s-Stock-Extension-SXT-19-07DEC14-KSC-v3](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/79542-25-SXT-Lack-s-Stock-Extension-SXT-19-07DEC14-KSC-v3)

Sweet! Thanks for help guys! Have some rep

And a shoutout to some really nice mod: Thanks for fixing the tag!

Here's a non-swastika'd version if you'd like.

![blog-ar-234_mg_9484_edited-2.jpg](https://travelforaircraft.files.wordpress.com/2070/10/blog-ar-234_mg_9484_edited-2.jpg)

SXT's He 111 isn't quite the same, but should serve, as mentioned.

Its not like Im bothered by it because its just a symbol, but thought I would apologize in advance if there was someone who finds it offensive, or something. Thanks for the replies. The cockpits look really good And Ill be looking into those once I have some spare time.
If SXT's He111 had a very minimal instrument panel, it might be my favorite cockpit.

Oh, I actually didn't take much notice of the Swastika. When I did, I just saw it as a symbol that was used in an earlier age. No more than that. I think leaving it in the picture would be a good thing, for posterity's sake.
